title: How to Make Pomegranate Infused Vodka

steps.headline: Sterilize a quart-sized jar by washing it in the dishwasher.
steps.description: Alternatively, you can submerge the jar in boiling water.

steps.headline: Fill 1 medium-sized bowl about 2/3 full of cold water.
Cut the pomegranate into quarters using a large knife.
Submerge each pomegranate quarter in the bowl of water.
steps.description: The membrane will float, and the seeds will sink to make separation easier.

steps.headline: Remove the flesh-covered seeds from the fruit and place them into the jar.
Repeat the process with each remaining quarter.
steps.description: Discard the membranes and the rinds in your garbage bin or compost pile.

steps.headline: Pour the vodka over the pomegranate seeds in the jar.
Seal the lid tightly and gently shake the mixture.
Place the jar in a dark, cool area and allow the mixture to infuse for 2 weeks.
steps.description: Gently shake the jar every 2 days so that the liquor in the jar infuses more evenly.

steps.headline: Remove the jar from its place of storage and open the lid.
steps.description: Place a piece of cheesecloth or a stainless steel mesh strainer over the mouth of the jar.

steps.headline: Pour the vodka into sterile bottles or jars.
steps.description: By pouring through the cheesecloth or the strainer, you will strain out the pomegranate seeds. Discard the seeds in your compost pile or garbage bin or store them for another use.

steps.headline: Store the vodka in the refrigerator until you are ready to use it.
steps.description: The finished product will be dark red in color.

text: Sterilize a quart-sized jar by washing it in the dishwasher. Alternatively, you can submerge the jar in boiling water. Fill 1 medium-sized bowl about 2/3 full of cold water.  Cut the pomegranate into quarters using a large knife.  Submerge each pomegranate quarter in the bowl of water. The membrane will float, and the seeds will sink to make separation easier. Remove the flesh-covered seeds from the fruit and place them into the jar.  Repeat the process with each remaining quarter. Discard the membranes and the rinds in your garbage bin or compost pile. Pour the vodka over the pomegranate seeds in the jar.  Seal the lid tightly and gently shake the mixture.  Place the jar in a dark, cool area and allow the mixture to infuse for 2 weeks. Gently shake the jar every 2 days so that the liquor in the jar infuses more evenly. Remove the jar from its place of storage and open the lid. Place a piece of cheesecloth or a stainless steel mesh strainer over the mouth of the jar. Pour the vodka into sterile bottles or jars. By pouring through the cheesecloth or the strainer, you will strain out the pomegranate seeds. Discard the seeds in your compost pile or garbage bin or store them for another use. Store the vodka in the refrigerator until you are ready to use it. The finished product will be dark red in color.
